page.title: 03RICHMOND HILL SCHOOL
page.content: Richmond Hill is a special school for children with learning difficulties. It was opened in 1961. There are 8 classes. We go to the Youth House every Tuesday for our P.E. lesson. On Thursday we go to Putteridge High School for our swimming lessons. We have Distar reading every morning with different teachers because there are different stages in it. Boys and girls have cooking on certain days. Class 1 have a chance to do baby day every Easter term. We get to hold the baby, feed it, change the nappy and make a meal for the mums. Mrs Miller is our cooking teacher she cooks very well. Mrs Payne does a computer lesson with class 1 every Wednesday afternoon. The school has a large playing field and a new pond area with a hide to watch the wild life.
